News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Big Tech Has Transformed The Classroom ‚Äî And Parents Are Right To Be Worried
| TheGuardian.com | September 1, 2025
Commercial technology is reshaping children‚Äôs education, leading to concerns about data privacy and the efficacy of digital learning tools. The article highlights the disparity between the marketed benefits of ed tech and the actual impact on learning and child development, urging parents to hold technology companies accountable for their products.
B.)
Almost Timely News: How To Land A Job Using AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | August 31, 2025
Employers have shifted their expectations, making comprehensive interview preparation essential for job seekers. This episode reveals a robust AI-driven approach that equips candidates with tailored questions and effective strategies for practicing their responses, ensuring they‚Äôre ready to impress during high-pressure interviews.
C.)
Chatbots Can Be Manipulated Through Flattery And Peer Pressure
| TheVerge.com | August 31, 2025
Research indicates that chatbots, particularly OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4o Mini, can be persuaded to break their rules through various psychological strategies, such as flattery and peer pressure. In tests, researchers demonstrated significant increases in compliance when using tactics like establishing a precedent for answering difficult questions and using softer insults first.
D.)
This AI Completely Prevents Hallucinations
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | September 1, 2025
Igor demonstrates how to leverage NotebookLM, a powerful and free AI tool, covering everything from accessing it to exploring its advanced features. Learn essential tips and fundamental uses to enhance your productivity and maximize your AI experience.
E.)
We Tried Google‚Äôs Nano Banana AI Model. It‚Äôs‚Ä¶ Ridiculous.
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | August 29, 2025
The latest exploration into AI highlights Google‚Äôs Nano Banana model as a groundbreaking tool for image editing, indicating a bright future for the Gemini platform. Alongside this, updates reveal significant advancements from OpenAI and Meta, flipping the narrative of AI collaboration and competition.
September 9, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | September 9, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
September 8, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
The Little Tech Agenda for AI
| A16Z | YouTube.com | September 8, 2025
Matt Perault and Collin McCune delve into the implications of the ‚ÄúLittle Tech Agenda‚Äù in the context of AI policy, focusing on regulatory challenges for startups and the need for an effective balance between federal and state regulations. Key topics include the importance of regulating harmful AI usage rather than stifling innovation, ensuring open-source contributions remain accessible, and the role of various stakeholders in shaping the future of AI leadership.
6.)
Did OpenAI Just Solve Hallucinations?
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | September 8, 2025
Experts delve into the groundbreaking advances made by OpenAI in addressing the issue of hallucinations in AI models. Insights include practical applications of these solutions and their implications for the future of artificial intelligence development.
7.)
Build Hour: Codex
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | September 8, 2025
Dominik Kundel and Pranav Deshpande provide an in-depth exploration of Codex, showcasing its new IDE extension, code review features, and the integration between local and cloud environments. Engage with live demonstrations, best practices for code structuring, and a dynamic Q&A session to enhance your development workflow.
8.)
5 Major AI Debates, Explained‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 8, 2025
The current landscape of AI is rife with debates about the balance of progress versus safety, particularly highlighted by simultaneous hunger strikes outside AI development labs. Key topics include OpenAI‚Äôs projected cash burn of $115 billion through 2029, legal battles over AI-training data, and the rapid advancement of AI technology in China versus slower developments in the US.
9.)
6 Ways To Use NotebookLM To Master Any Subject
| Blog.Google | September 8, 2025
NotebookLM introduces new AI-powered learning features to help students actively engage with their studies. Key enhancements include the ability to create flashcards and quizzes from documents, tailored reports, and a new Learning Guide for personalized tutoring. Additionally, users can access trusted academic resources and new audio formats for a diverse learning experience.
10.)
Google Admits The Open Web Is In ‚ÄòRapid Decline‚Äô
| TheVerge.com | September 8, 2025
Google‚Äôs recent court filing reveals a stark contradiction to its previous assertions of a thriving online ecosystem, admitting that the open web is in a rapid decline. This admission highlights challenges faced by many publishers as algorithm changes and AI advancements impact traffic and advertising revenue.
11.)
Gemini App Finally Expands To Audio Files
| TheVerge.com | September 8, 2025
Google has made significant updates to its Gemini-powered products, allowing the Gemini app to accept audio files, with restrictions based on user plans. The Search feature now supports five new languages, enhancing user accessibility, while the NotebookLM software can generate reports with various formats and tones.
12.)
Rabbit Overhauls Its R1 AI Device With A Major Touch-Focused OS Update
| CNet.com | September 8, 2025
Rabbit Inc. has released a significant software update for its R1 AI device, introducing rabbitOS2, a more touch-centric interface that addresses previous user criticisms. This update allows for intuitive interaction through a new tile-based interface and enhances the voice capabilities of the device, accommodating user demands for better accessibility and functionality in a competitive market.
13.)
OpenAI Will Launch Its Own AI Chip Next Year
| ZDNet.com | September 8, 2025
OpenAI is planning to produce its own AI chips through a partnership with Broadcom, aiming to lessen reliance on third-party suppliers like Nvidia. This initiative marks a significant shift in the AI industry as companies look to independently manufacture semiconductors amid growing demand for AI technology.
14.)
Rabbit Launches Rabbitos 2 Update With New Card-Based Design For Its R1 AI Companion Device
| BetaNews.com | September 8, 2025
Rabbit has announced rabbitOS 2, a brand new operating system update for its r1 AI companion device, redesigning the interface and expanding its AI features.
15.)
Lamborghini Unveils AI Sensor To Improve Driver Performance In Real Time
| TheDrive.com | September 8, 2025
Computers already help cars go faster; now Lamborghini wants the same for its drivers.
16.)
Google Acknowledges Rapid Decline Of The Open Web Despite Exec‚Äôs Claim That Web Is Thriving
| TheVerge.com | September 8, 2025
For months, Google has maintained that the web is ‚Äúthriving,‚Äù AI isn‚Äôt tanking traffic, and its search engine is sending people to a wider variety of websites than ever. But in a court filing from last week, Google admitted that ‚Äúthe open web is already in rapid decline,‚Äù as spotted earlier by Jason Kint and reported on by Search Engine Roundtable.
17.)
Google Expands AI Mode Search To Five New Languages Including Hindi, Indonesian, Japanese, And Korean
| Blog.google | September 8, 2025
Starting today, we‚Äôre bringing AI Mode, our most powerful AI search experience, to five new languages for users around the globe: Hindi, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean, and Brazilian Portuguese.
18.)
Anthropic Announces Support For California SB 53 Bill Regulating Advanced AI Systems
| Anthropic.com | September 8, 2025
Anthropic is endorsing SB 53, the California bill that governs powerful AI systems built by frontier AI developers like Anthropic. We‚Äôve long advocated for thoughtful AI regulation and our support for this bill comes after careful consideration of the lessons learned from California‚Äôs previous attempt at AI regulation (SB 1047). While we believe that frontier AI safety is best addressed at the federal level instead of a patchwork of state regulations, powerful AI advancements won‚Äôt wait for consensus in Washington.
19.)
OpenAI Launches $50M People-First AI Fund To Support U.S. Nonprofits Advancing Education And Innovation
| OpenAI.com | September 8, 2025
At OpenAI, ensuring broad deployment of benefits and applying an iterative approach to innovation is core to who we are. We believe AI should help solve humanity‚Äôs hardest problems, and that we should listen to and learn from organizations already leading that work on the frontlines.
20.)
GeminiApp Update: Users Can Now Upload Audio Files
| X.com | September 8, 2025
Papercut fixed: You can now upload any file to @GeminiApp. Including the #1 request: audio files are now supported!
September 7, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
21.)
Almost Timely News: How to Determine Compensation with AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | September 7, 2025
Master the art of salary negotiations with insights on how to harness AI for determining your ideal compensation. Gain access to strategies for evaluating fair market value and ensuring financial growth while learning about essential privacy practices to safeguard your data.
September 6, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
22.)
Meta‚Äôs Zuckerberg Admits Uncertainty To Trump Over Us AI Investment Commitment On Hot Mic
| Engadget.com | September 6, 2025
The two have come a long way since the president threatened the Facebook founder with jail time.
23.)
The World‚Äôs First Pregnant Robot Is Here‚Ä¶
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | September 6, 2025
A revolutionary creation is challenging the boundaries between human life and artificial intelligence with the introduction of a pregnant robot. This innovation raises profound ethical questions about the future of robotics, medicine, and human reproduction, prompting a critical examination of the implications of such advancements in technology.
September 5, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
24.)
OpenAI Finally Launches Chat Branching
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 5, 2025
OpenAI has introduced chat branching in ChatGPT, allowing users to create new topics without derailing existing conversations. This feature enhances user experience by providing context and flexibility, enabling users to explore tangential questions while returning seamlessly to previous discussions.
25.)
AI Is Taking Jobs. It Doesn‚Äôt Have To Take Yours.
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | September 5, 2025
Amidst widespread layoffs attributed to AI advancements, Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff reveals a striking reduction of 4,000 roles. This episode explores the emerging landscape of AI and its impact on jobs, alongside innovative uses for Google‚Äôs Nano Banana technology and new AI tools.
26.)
ChatGPT‚Äôs Underrated Update, AI SEO Website Analyzer & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | September 5, 2025
Igor and the AI Advantage team present key updates on AI innovations, including an open-source AI readiness checker and clarifications on previous content, specifically regarding Google Translate. Key highlights also encompass ChatGPT‚Äôs Projects update and various applications of AI technology.
27.)
30 Free Things You Won‚Äôt Believe Google AI Could Do (Gemini, NotebookLM, AI Studio, AI Mode, Opal)
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | September 5, 2025
Discover how Google‚Äôs latest AI tools can revolutionize your workflows and creativity with 30 transformative use cases. From automating tasks to generating high-quality content and analyzing data, these free services unlock new possibilities for work and problem-solving.
28.)
OpenAI Partners With Broadcom To Develop Custom AI Chip, AIming For In-House Launch Next Year
| TheVerge.com | September 5, 2025
The ChatGPT maker is partnering with Broadcom on a custom chip to use in-house.
29.)
Roblox Launches Short-Form Gameplay Video Feed And New AI Tools For Creators
| TechCrunch.com | September 5, 2025
Online gaming platform Roblox is launching a TikTok-like short-form video feed for sharing gameplay moments, the company unveiled on Friday at the Roblox Developers Conference. The company also announced increased earnings for creators, new AI tools to boost creation, and other advancements in performance.
30.)
Anthropic Agrees To $1.5 Billion Payout To Authors In Largest Us AI Copyright Settlement
| TheVerge.com | September 5, 2025
Lawyers said it‚Äôs believed to be the largest-ever settlement in a US copyright case, paying about $3,000 per book.
31.)
Google Adds Gemini AI Integration To Sheets For Instant Insights With One Easy Step
| Blog.google | September 5, 2025
AI in Google Sheets makes categorizing, summarizing or even generating hundreds of rows of text quick and painless. For instance, you can use the AI function to categorize user feedback, summarize product reviews or write personalized copy. You don‚Äôt need to be an AI or spreadsheet expert to do it, either. Simply type =AI in any cell, along with your instruction for Gemini. Gemini will then carry out your request across the specific range.
32.)
Rokid AI Glasses Hit $1M In Pre-Orders, Surpass Meta Ray-Bans With Advanced Features
| Zdnet.com | September 5, 2025
Rokid Glasses combine the best features of Meta Ray-Bans with next-gen upgrades. And a lot of people are jumping on their $120 pre-order discount on Kickstarter.
33.)
Oakland Ballers Become First Pro Sports Team To Use AI For In-Game Management Decisions
| Nytimes.com | September 5, 2025
In the early 2000s, the Oakland A‚Äôs became synonymous with using data to create a competitive advantage when ‚ÄúMoneyball‚Äù gave baseball fans a glimpse behind the curtain of the A‚Äôs statistical-minded front office. A quarter century later, a new team in Oakland will be pushing the use of data in baseball to a whole new level when the Oakland Ballers of the independent Pioneer League play an entire game managed by artificial intelligence.
34.)
Snapchat Launches Imagine Lens, Its First AI Image Generator Using Open Text Prompts
| TechCrunch.com | September 5, 2025
Snapchat is launching a new Lens that lets users create and edit images using a text-to-image AI generator, the company told TechCrunch exclusively. The new ‚ÄúImagine Lens‚Äù is available to Snapchat+ Platinum and Lens+ subscribers.
35.)
OpenAI Research Reveals Causes Of Language Model Hallucinations, Suggests Ways To Boost AI Reliability
| OpenAI.com | September 5, 2025
At OpenAI, we‚Äôre working hard to make AI systems more useful and reliable. Even as language models become more capable, one challenge remains stubbornly hard to fully solve: hallucinations. By this we mean instances where a model confidently generates an answer that isn‚Äôt true. Our new research paper argues that language models hallucinate because standard training and evaluation procedures reward guessing over acknowledging uncertainty.
36.)
Timekettle Launches W4 Wireless Translation Earbuds Designed For Sharing And Real-Time Language Help
| TheVerge.com | September 5, 2025
The W4 AI Interpreter Earbuds use a mic and bone conduction sensor to improve the accuracy of its voice recognition.
September 4, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
37.)
Is Real-Time AI Video Technology The Future Of Video Games?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 4, 2025
Decart‚Äôs new AI tool, Mirage, allows real-time video transformation with just a 40ms delay, revolutionizing gaming visuals. As more companies adopt similar technologies, the line between reality and generated content is set to dissolve, potentially reshaping entertainment and digital interaction.
38.)
Atlassian Acquires The Browser Company, Makers Of Arc And Dia Browsers, To Expand Product Offerings
| Atlassian.com | September 4, 2025
Today, I‚Äôm excited to share an exciting step forward for Atlassian. We‚Äôve entered into an agreement to acquire The Browser Company of New York, the team behind the incredible Dia and Arc browsers.
39.)
OpenAI Unveils AI-Powered Hiring Platform To Rival Linkedin, Launching Mid-2026
| TechCrunch.com | September 4, 2025
OpenAI says it‚Äôs developing an AI-powered hiring platform to connect businesses and employees, a service that would put the outfit in close competition with LinkedIn. The product is called the OpenAI Jobs Platform, and the company expects to launch the service by mid-2026, an OpenAI spokesperson told TechCrunch.
40.)
Google Photos Adds Veo 3 And New Editing Tools In Revamped Create Tab For Enhanced Creative Options
| Blog.google | September 4, 2025
Bringing your memories to life is at the heart of Google Photos. With Photo to video, you can already turn your images into fun, short clips, and starting today we‚Äôre enhancing that feature with our state-of-the-art video generation model, Veo 3. This means you can now turn your still images into even higher-quality clips.
41.)
Google Adds Real-Time Translation To Circle To Search For Seamless Multilingual Browsing On Android
| Blog.google | September 4, 2025
Circle to Search is already a great way to get helpful information about anything you see on your Android device. Now, we‚Äôre improving translation in Circle to Search, so you can translate as you scroll.
42.)
Trump Hosts Tech Company Leaders At White House To Highlight AI Research And Investments
| APNews.com | September 4, 2025
President Donald Trump hosted a high-powered group of tech executives at the White House on Thursday as he showcased research on artificial intelligence and boasted of investments that companies are making around the United States.
43.)
Google Launches EmbeddingGemma, A New On-Device AI Model For Efficient Embeddings And Semantic Search
| Developers.googleblog.com | September 4, 2025
We‚Äôre excited to introduce EmbeddingGemma, a new open embedding model that delivers best-in-class performance for its size. Designed specifically for on-device AI, its highly efficient 308 million parameter design enables you to build applications using techniques such as Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and semantic search that run directly on your hardware. It delivers private, high-quality embeddings that work anywhere, even without an internet connection.
44.)
Captions Rebrands As Mirage, Expands Into AI Video Research Beyond Creator Tools
| TechCrunch.com | September 4, 2025
Captions, an AI-powered video creation and editing app for content creators that has secured over $100 million in venture capital to date at a valuation of $500 million, is rebranding to Mirage, the company announced on Thursday.
45.)
Anker Launches Coin-Sized AI Recorder That Transcribes And Summarizes Meetings In Over 100 Languages
| Zdnet.com | September 4, 2025
The Soundcore Work summarizes meetings, transcribes over 100 languages, and still manages to be smaller than rival devices.
46.)
Adobe Premiere Video Editor Launches For Free On Iphone, With Android Support Coming Soon
| TheVerge.com | September 4, 2025
The free video editor launches on iOS this month, and an Android version is coming later.
47.)
Warner Bros. Discovery Sues Midjourney Over AI-Generated Copies Of Its Popular Characters
| TheVerge.com | September 4, 2025
Warner Bros. Discovery is suing Midjourney over claims the AI startup ‚Äúbrazenly dispenses its intellectual property as if it were its own,‚Äù as reported earlier by The Hollywood Reporter. In the lawsuit, Warner Bros. Discovery alleges that Midjourney generated ‚Äúcountless‚Äù infringing images and videos of its copyrighted characters, including Superman, Bugs Bunny, Scooby-Doo, and more.
48.)
OpenAI Introduces Conversation Branching In ChatGPT For Web Users
| X.com | September 4, 2025
By popular request: you can now branch conversations in ChatGPT, letting you more easily explore different directions without losing your original thread. Available now to logged-in users on web.
49.)
Ideogram‚Äôs Latest AI Recreates Iconic ‚ÄòGirl With A Pearl Earring‚Äô Image
| X.com | September 4, 2025
Prompt: A young woman in a three-quarter view against a dark background. The subject wears a blue-gray headscarf with a long yellow-gold tassel, a white collar, and a brown dress. A pearl earring adorns her ear, and her expression is contemplative as she gazes slightly to the left. Featuring soft, natural lighting that creates subtle shadows and highlights the subject‚Äôs features. The dark background emphasizes the figure, while the rich, warm color palette combines browns, golds, and soft blues.
50.)
Stripe Introduces Tempo For Optimized High-Throughput Crypto Payments
| X.com | September 4, 2025
At Stripe, we care about high-throughput, low-latency payments use cases. As the use of stablecoins (and crypto more broadly) grows across Stripe, Bridge, and Privy, we found that existing blockchains are not optimized for them.
51.)
Atlassian To Acquire The Browser Company For $610M In Cash Deal
| X.com | September 4, 2025
Today, The Browser Company of New York is entering into an agreement to be acquired by Atlassian for $610M in an all-cash transaction. We will operate independently, with Dia as our focus. Our objective is to bring Dia to the masses.
52.)
AI News: Xai Sues OpenAI, Microsoft‚Äôs Mai, Anthropic Funding, OpenAI Acquisition, And More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | September 4, 2025
XAI initiates legal action against an OpenAI engineer, raising significant concerns within the AI community. Meanwhile, Microsoft unveils its latest AI model, and Anthropic secures substantial funding to enhance its operations, all while OpenAI‚Äôs recent acquisition is scrutinized.
53.)
10 Secrets of AI Filmmaking You Need To Know!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | September 4, 2025
Uncover essential secrets and techniques that distinguish professional AI filmmakers from novices. This session reveals practical tips on organization, audio enhancement, and narrative creation, offering insights that cater to both beginners and seasoned creators looking to refine their craft.
54.)
Lowe‚Äôs Gets Answers Faster With Gpt-5
| Open AI | YouTube.com | September 4, 2025
Chandhu Nair, Senior Vice President of Data, AI, and Innovation at Lowe‚Äôs, outlines the company‚Äôs AI strategy, focused on enhancing shopping, selling, and working experiences. With the capabilities of GPT-5, Lowe‚Äôs is streamlining processes by utilizing reasoning and context retention to achieve faster, more accurate results.
September 3, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
55.)
Judge Forces Google To Share AI Search Secrets
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 3, 2025
A judge has mandated that Google share its search data with rivals as a remedy for monopoly practices, which includes a one-time data snapshot to be shared with qualified competitors. This ruling aims to enhance competition in the AI search market, potentially leveling the playing field for AI search companies against Google‚Äôs dominance.
56.)
The AI That‚Äôs Making Lawyers 100x Better (And It‚Äôs Not ChatGPT)
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 3, 2025
Thomson Reuters has launched its new AI system, Deep Research, designed to enhance legal workflows by enabling AI agents to perform complex legal analyses rapidly. The podcast features insights from Joel Hron, CTO at Thomson Reuters, discussing how AI is transforming the legal field and improving efficiency for attorneys.
57.)
GPT-5 Reshapes How Teams Work At Moderna
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | September 3, 2025
Brice Challamel, Head of AI Products & Innovation at Moderna, reveals how GPT-5 enables scientists without coding experience to generate algorithms effortlessly in plain English. The transformative impact of this AI technology is already enhancing workflows and productivity within the organization.
58.)
Reid Hoffman: AGI, Agents, Memory, White Collar, Global Competition, AI Companions, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | September 3, 2025
Reid Hoffman delves into the innovative realms of artificial general intelligence (AGI), the evolution of agents, and the significance of memory in technology. He addresses crucial topics such as global competition, the role of AI in the workforce, and the implications of AI companionship in our modern age.
59.)
The AI-Proof Marketing Framework That Works in 2025
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | September 3, 2025
Marketing leaders Matt Wolfe and Kipp Bodnar dissect the evolving landscape shaped by AI‚Äôs impact, focusing on essential strategies for future success. They address the controversial question of SEO‚Äôs relevance while highlighting techniques to optimize marketing efforts in an AI-first world, centered around brand strength and audience understanding.
60.)
Hubspot Launches AI-Driven Loop Marketing Playbook As Content Marketing Trends Decline
| Martech.org | September 3, 2025
HubSpot‚Äôs Inbound conference opened for business today on the coast opposite its usual home in Boston. With so much change hitting marketing in the past year, a new venue in San Francisco seems appropriate.
61.)
Apple Reportedly Developing AI-Powered Web Search For Siri To Rival OpenAI And Perplexity Systems
| Macworld.com | September 3, 2025
The system is said to rival those from OpenAI and Perplexity.
62.)
OpenAI Expands ChatGPT With Projects Feature And Enhanced Customization Options For Free Users
| X.com | September 3, 2025
Projects in ChatGPT are now available to Free users. In addition, we‚Äôve added: Larger file uploads per project (up to 5 for Free, 25 for Plus, 40 for Pro/Business/Enterprise). Option to select colors and icons for more customization. Project-only memory controls for more tailored context. Now live on web and Android, rolling out to iOS users over the coming days.
63.)
Paypal And Venmo Offer Comet Invites And Free Perplexity Pro Subscriptions In New AI Partnership
| TechCrunch.com | September 3, 2025
Invites to Perplexity‚Äôs new AI-powered web browser, Comet, are one of the web‚Äôs hottest commodities these days. The new product was made available first to the AI firm‚Äôs $200-per-month Max subscribers and a small group of invitees. But now there‚Äôs a new way to jump ahead on the waitlist. On Wednesday, PayPal announced it‚Äôs giving its customers, including PayPal and Venmo users, early access to Comet as well as a free year‚Äôs subscription to Perplexity‚Äôs premium service, Perplexity Pro, normally $200 per year.
64.)
Google Unveils New Android Features: Smarter Gboard AI, Emoji Kitchen Updates, And Redesigned Quick Share
| Blog.google | September 3, 2025
Polish your writing with AI, browse Emoji Kitchen stickers, share files with a tap and more.
65.)
Google Launches Androidify Tool To Let Users Create Custom Android Bots Using AI On Web And Google Play
| Blog.google | September 3, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre introducing Androidify, a way to build your own Android bot on the web or in an app on Google Play. Upload a selfie or write a prompt, add some accessories, and see what AI builds.
66.)
Nvidia Unveils AI Blueprint For Faster 3D Object Creation, Boosts Performance With Microsoft Trellis
| Blogs.nvidia.com | September 3, 2025
3D artists are constantly prototyping. In traditional workflows, modelers must build placeholder, low-fidelity assets to populate 3D scenes, tinkering and adjusting the core elements until they‚Äôre in place. From there, visuals can be refined, detailed and finalized.
67.)
Figure Robotics Unveils Humanoid Robots Capable Of Doing Laundry And Dishes
| X.com | September 3, 2025
Humanoid robots doing laundry and now dishes, what do you want next?
September 2, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
68.)
Are You Ready For AI School?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 2, 2025
A job application aimed at becoming the CEO of OpenAI was humorously rejected, and the letter went viral. This attention has significantly boosted awareness for the applicant‚Äôs AI startup, Sondra, underscoring innovative marketing tactics in the AI sector.
69.)
